Browfile Class Reference

A managed object which knows static information about an OwnerApp and its exformat.  To avoid duplication, a browfile can only be obtained using one of the Browfiler class methods.  For the same reason, an extore can only be obtained from one of the browfile instance methods.  Thus, an extore must always have a browfile. Detailed Description

A managed object which knows static information about an OwnerApp and its exformat.  To avoid duplication, a browfile can only be obtained using one of the Browfiler class methods.  For the same reason, an extore can only be obtained from one of the browfile instance methods.  Thus, an extore must always have a browfile.

GLOSSARY Browser: An installed browser application such as Safari, Camino, etc. Service: Google Bookmarks, del.icio.us, etc. OwnerApp: A Browser (installed application) or a Service (web application) Exformat: The format and structure of the bookmarks in an OwnerApp Browfile: structure of a profile or account supported by a particular ownerApp, or a builtout browfile. Examples: > structure of a particular Firefox profile > structure of a particular Google Bookmarks account > structure of a particular loose bookmarks file

Member Function Documentation

- (Browid *) browid  

Returns a browid (browfile identifier) which specifies all of the receiver's constant properties and is unique among browfiles.

See Browid class overview for precise specification. 

- (BOOL) browserInstalledIsOkError_p: (NSError**)  error_p  

If the receiver's extoreMedia is BkmxExtoreMediaThisUser, checks if the browser indicated by the receiver's ownerApp is installed on the system, and whether its version meets the minimum requirement of the receiver's minBrowserVersion.

If the receiver's extoreMedia is not constBkmxExtoreMediaThisUser, returns YES unconditionally.

Parameters:
error_p If result is NO, upon return, will point to an NSError explaining the problem.
Returns:
YES if browser is installed and meets minimum version requirement, NO otherwise.

- (NSString *) definingFilePath  

Returns the receiver's filePath or filePathParent, whichever is first not nil, in that order.

OmniWeb returns filePathParent instead of filePath since it stores bookmarks in three separate files in there.

Returns:
A POSIX path

- (NSString *) displayName  

Returns the name by which the user refers to the extore.

Somewhat abbreviated, not guaranteed to be unique.  It's an engineering compromise.

- (Extore*) extore  

Returns the extore owned by the receiver, creating one if needed, with a default BkmxDeference of BkmxDeferenceAsk and a nil Bookshelf.

A newly-created Browfile instance does not have an extore. A transient Browfile instance created for a simple purpose may never require one. However, once one is created, it is stored as an ivar.

Returns:
An extore whose class is the subclass of Extore given by -extoreClass

- (Extore *) extoreWithDeference: (BkmxDeference)  deference
bookshelf: (Bookshelf*)  bookshelf 

Returns the extore owned by the receiver, creating one if needed, with a specified BkmxDeference and bookshelf and a nil Bookshelf.

A newly-created Browfile instance does not have an extore. A transient Browfile instance created for a simple purpose may never require one. However, once one is created, it is stored as an ivar.

Parameters:
deference The value of the ivar 'deference' to set in the receiver.
bookshelf The Bookshelf to which progress messages will be sent during ixternalizations.
Returns:
An extore whose class is the subclass of Extore given by -extoreClass

- (NSString *) filePathParent  

Returns the path to the parent directory containing the receiver's browser's bookmarks file or files, or nil if the receiver's browser does not have a single bookmarks file.

For a web service, returns the path on the server at which the bookmarks API is accessed.

- (NSString *) homePath  

Encodes the two otherMacXXXXX values from a given a dictionary into a full filesystem path to a Home directory in the /Volumes directory.

See +[BrowidCodecs homePathWithParts] for precise specification.

- (BOOL) isSameIdentity: (Browfile*)  otherBrowfile  

Compares the 'parts' of the receiver with the 'parts' of another browfile.

Returns:
YES if all corresponding parts are the same, otherwise NO.

- (NSString *) ownerAppFullPath  

Returns either the full path to the receiver's ownerApp if it is installed as a desktop application, or a URL to the receiver's API if it is a web service application, or nil.

Returns nil if the receiver -ownerAppIsLocalApp but is not installed.

- (void) setIfLaterLastKnownTouch: (NSDate*)  proposedDate  

Sets the receiver's lastKnownTouch to a new value, but only if it is later than the current value of lastKnownTouch.

Parameters:
proposedDate 

Property Documentation

- (NSString*) exformat [read, write, copy]

The external format of the receiver.

This is required for all browfiles.

- (NSString*) extoreMedia [read, write, copy]

The external storage media of the receiver.

One of the BkmxExtoreMediaXXXXX constants.

- (NSDate*) lastKnownTouch [read, write, copy]

The last date that we know the external store's data was touched.

With some extores, particularly those whose owners are web apps, the "last touched" value given by their API may exclude some touches that we know about (usually because we did them).  Therefore, we record whenever we know that the extore was touched.  Therefore, -[Extore lastDateExternalWasTouched] should always look at this date and return it if it is later than the date it found.

- (NSDate *) lastLocalMocSync [read, write, retain]

Should be used to set and get the last time that the receiver's local managed object context was synced with the external store.

Since this time may be affected for more than one browfile (with the same browid) in different Bookshelfs, it is stored in user defaults.  It is not KVObserveable.

- (NSData*) looseFileAlias [read, write, retain]

Data of an alias record identifying the external store file of the receiver.

Browfiles of extoreMedia BkmxExtoreMediaLoose must have this attribute. Other extoreMedia types must not have this attribute.

- (NSString*) otherMacAccount [read, write, copy]

The Macintosh account name of the receiver.

Browfiles of extoreMedia BkmxExtoreMediaOtherUser must have this attribute. Other extoreMedia types must not have this attribute.

- (NSString*) otherMacVolume [read, write, copy]

The Macintosh Volume name, in the file system, of the receiver.

Browfiles of extoreMedia BkmxExtoreMediaOtherUser may have this attribute. Other extoreMedia types must not have this attribute.

- (NSString*) profileName [read, write, copy]

The profile name or account name of the receiver.

Of the desktopApp extores, only Firefox have one of these.  All webApp extores have one of these.

- (NSString*) profileNameAlternate [read, write, copy]

An additional profile name or account name of the receiver.

This is used for Google browfiles because Google can have regular email or a gmail email which both access the same account.
